metadata.ttm:title: eOffer/eMod Homepage
metadata.ttm:desc: Within the eMod/eOffer system there are two modules, both of which are accessible on the right-hand side of the screen in the box marked "System Access." Each module serves its own distinct purposes, and these videos will illuminate the step-by-step processes associated with each.

div.p: The eOffer/eMod system is a web-based application
that allows companies to electronically prepare and
submit MAS contract proposals and contract
modifications to GSA.
At any point, as you are proceeding through these
systems, you can click the "video" icon on the screen
to get help with completing a particular
section.
On the right side of the homepage, you will notice
boxes that allow you to prepare Contract Offers,
and Contract Modifications This homepage provides
links to a wealth of information that you can
review before getting started with an eOffer or
eMod.
The "About eOffer" section provides high level
information about the systems.
By clicking the links, you can learn more about
eOffers and eMods.
The "Digital Certificates" and "Authorized
Negotiator" links are useful for vendors who are
having trouble accessing the system because they
have either: not obtained or loaded their digital
certificate, or they have not been designated as a
negotiator assigned to their company's contract.
Note that, without a valid certificate, it is
impossible to do anything in eOffer/eMod at all.
The "Subcontracting Plan" template provides offerors
with a model template that can be modified and
included in their contract offer.
Subcontracting plans are generally applicable to
certain "Other than Small Businesses," who meet a
certain dollar threshold.
Finally, the "MAS Schedule Solicitations" link will
provide you with links to each of the schedule
solicitations.
The Customer Assistance and Training section
provides links to User Guides, Frequently Asked
Questions, GSA Contact Information, The "Before
you Begin" section basically provides you
with a "To Do List" of things that you should
complete prior to submitting an Offer or a
Modification.
Items include reviewing solicitations, completing
training, Did you get your DUNs number?
Audio change needed "Registering with SAM
(formerly CCR and Orca) "Have you applied for your
digital cert?"
, and more.
Whenever you are ready to begin a Contract Offer or
Modification, simply click the "Sign In" link.
If your digital certificate is properly
loaded to your browser, you will be granted access
to the system.
